item.title: Post Agenda
item.description: I have experimented with a few exciting things that I always wanted to try. To share with the world and also keep track of what I did. I am going to put them here. so this blog is first of all a note for myself and you might just find something interesting about it that you would like to keep in mind. there will be a few sections for my blog

item.title: Do I need to click build website every time?
item.description: see if this one will be uploaded.

item.title: H2O with R Part 1
item.description: Today I have run into H2O again in a blog post. It is well known for its speed in model calculations because the whole H2O machine learning framework is written in Java and all calculations are thus optimized for speedy performance. In case you never deal with Java before, it is a general purpose programming language that could do many things from developing a game to builidng a web scrapping tool.

item.title: How to start business analytics with R
item.description: Extend your data analytics skill from Excel to R to make whatever you do much faster!!

item.title: This time I try Rmd File
item.description: library(lubridate) ## ## Attaching package: 'lubridate' ## The following object is masked from 'package:base': ## ## date library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:lubridate': ## ## intersect, setdiff, union ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union After loading the packages, we obtain the dataset from Dastaset library on Ozone.

item.title: Try R markdown in Academic
item.description: We fist load some libraries for handling the data. library(lubridate) ## ## Attaching package: 'lubridate' ## The following object is masked from 'package:base': ## ## date library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:lubridate': ## ## intersect, setdiff, union ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union Let’s work on some Ozone data here.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
